review_text:
The location was key, we loved being so close to the historic section of Savannah. There is alot of foot traffic in front of the house during the day, but the nights were quiet while we were there. We used the front porch every afternoon. The off street parking was very important as parking is very limited.
The house is â€œhistoricâ€ so there are things that one must expect. We had one person in our group who was recovering from a broken foot and was using a cane. Floors were uneven in areas so she had to be wary of where those spots were! Just an observation, not a complaint.
The outdoor area in back seemed a bit winter weary so we never did hang out there. It was our first visit to Savannah and we all want to return and part of that is due to our stay at this house!

Very clean with a good supply of kitchen basics and nice amenities (makeup remover cloths, basic first aid supplies, bug spray, extra paper goods). The information book provided is full of helpful information for your trip. Kroger is a 3 min walk down the street and there are several options for meals and/or drinks in the neighborhood. We didnâ€™t make it to the nearby coffee shop that looked amazing (hopefully next time ;) but the bar in The Mansion on Forsyth across the street is beautiful. The backyard is gorgeous but given the season really buggy so we werenâ€™t able to enjoy it as much as we would have liked. I bet itâ€™s perfect on cool fall or winter nights. We did spend several evenings just lounging on the porch enjoying a beautiful evening in a stunning city. Iâ€™ve stayed at multiple Airbnb locations and The Garden Suite is now one of my favorites. Stayed a few nights
review_text: Janet's place was immaculate and everything we hoped for and more! It felt so clean the moment we walked into the door, and the beautifully decorated rooms looked professionally put together. We instantly felt the place was professionally sanitized, which made us feel so comfortable and safe during this weird COVID-19 time. The location could not of been more perfect - a short walk to Forsythe Park and a quick drive to downtown (we could have walked if we wanted to, but were traveling with my husband's parents!) Traveling with my in-laws, my husband and I still felt we had our own private place with a separate bathroom and bedroom, and my in-laws could not have been more pleased as well! The garden sitting area was so tranquil and a beautiful bonus, as well as relaxing on the front porch. Perfect!

name: Leah
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2019
,
Â·
Group trip
review_text:
My family and I had an amazing stay thanks to the exceptionally high quality of the home created by Janet and her team!
Everything was spotlessly clean, well organized, clearly labelled, and worked perfectly. I felt like I was staying at home, because I didn't have to go hunting for anything- there was always a helpful sign pointing the way. The apartment is also very tastefully decorated- if you like to take vacation photos you will not have anything to hide here.
The location is perfect- close enough to the riverside and other attractions to walk, but not at all in a noisy, tourist-y area. The garden is beautiful as well, and obviously gets a lot of tlc. We felt like locals, and we kept saying it was time to "go home" instead of "go back to the hotel."
Janet has done a tremendous job on the garden suite, and I can only assume her other properties are exceptional as well. I highly recommend any of her homes. Janet gives AirBNB a good name, and I look forward to staying with her whenever I return to Savannah.

review_text: We were thoroughly impressed with the Garden Suite. It is a lovely house in the Victorian district of Savannah just steps away from the big park. The suite, itself, couldn't have been more perfect for our "girl cousins" weekend! The house has a nice front porch, good for people watching. The bathrooms, kitchen, living room, and bedrooms were all super clean (very important to me) and they were also very well decorated with modern touches and colors. On the other hand, the suite still managed to maintain some of it's Victorian charm with hardwood floors, and chandeliers from that time period. Janet gave us good information on where to dine, and what to do in Savannah which was extremely helpful. I will never stay anywhere else in Savannah again. Thank you, Janet. Lauren from Orlando

We could not find parking anywhere on the street ( because of the festival). I called Sarah and she directed us to another reserved spot less than a block away. her response was immediate and Michael came over to check on us and make sure we were able to find parking. I thought that was very kind of them. Two thumbs way up!!

review_text:
We would definitely recommend the Amethyst Abode for a stay in Savannah. The location was great: a residential area just a few blocks from Forsyth Park and not far from all the historic sites. A Kroger grocery store and Starbucks were around the corner.
We appreciated having a dedicated parking spot in the private lot right behind the unit, but there was always plenty of free parking on the street in front. We took an Uber to River Street and other sites.
The unit was very clean and well-appointed and came with complimentary snacks, K-cups and creamers, and toiletries.
My friend and I appreciated having two King rooms with two separate bathrooms. The beds were extremely comfortable. One bath had a walk-in shower and the other had a shower/soaking tub with high sides.
Being on ground level made loading and unloading easy, but we could hear people walking (sometimes stomping) in the unit above us. Otherwise, the Abode was quiet. The hosts were very responsive.

I can't begin to say enough about this GORGEOUS home, or it's FABULOUS hosts. For SCAD parents, this home is a 3 minute walk to the Deloitte Foundry and a 6 minute drive to "The Hive." It's a quick 2 minute walk to Kroger, a 5 minute walk to Collins Quarter at Forsyth Park where they serve a phenomenal brunch. There are lots of things to do nearby and within walking distance.
Directions to this beautiful home and entrance into it were perfectly detailed and easy to understand. Sarah was always quick to respond before, during, and after our stay. The home itself was GORGEOUS and perfect for our needs. Attention was paid to every detail to ensure our comfort during our stay. The beds were THE BEST we have ever slept in. We literally "melted" into bed each night. Sarah made sure that we had a little basket of goodies upon our arrival. Quiet, peaceful, and enjoyable stay was had by all 3 of us. The floors in this home are stunning. Thank you so much!

review_text:
This is the bottom apartment (slightly below street level) of a three-story townhouse. Another apartment is in the upper two floors.
The apartment, furnishings and appliances all seem brand new. Decor is modern. Chairs and beds are comfortable. Paint seems brand new too. The floor has been done in a faux marble sort of effect, which -- to say the least -- catches your eye when you first see it, but you get used to it quickly.
The host was very responsive and answered every message quickly.
The same host operates the upper apartment. During my week's stay there were three different families renting for a day or two each above me. Depending on the number and energy of the children there could be some foot noise from upstairs. Not really that bothersome, and it's no one's fault: It's just inherent in the way the building is constructed. Otherwise the apartment is quiet and pleasant.
Very pleasant stay.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Cozy, clean and charming. Very happy it looked just like the photos. There was a really good energy when we walked in. I felt comfortable right away and definitely not skeeved out like I've felt at other places. We even joked about being single with no kids and living in a cute little place like this. I really loved all the light that shines in, making it bright and cheery during the day. No noise issues sleeping at night. Easy walk to Forsyth Park and coffee and breakfast place. Walking home from downtown is a bit of a walk after you've walked around all day. Its probably close to 2 miles. Uber is about $8 so there's that option. Parking is free on the street in front.
One small suggestion, if you like it to be cold at night while you're sleeping I would recommend bringing a small fan to aide the a/c in cooling the bedroom down a little more.
Overall, we loved this beautiful, cozy little spot and we would stay again for sure :)

review_text: This was our first trip to Savannah and we could not have picked a better location for our home base. Michael and Sarahâ€™s apartment was no more than 10 minutes from everywhere we wanted to go. The proximity to Forsyth Park is especially nice. The only thing keeping me from giving five stars was the temp inside the apartment. Weâ€™re from Alabama and are used to summer heat. But we do expect to be comfortable when weâ€™re indoors. Contacted host about temps and was told to run units at 70 and close curtains during the day. Did as told but it was still really warm. Units were blowing cold air, they just werenâ€™t adequately cooling the rooms. We went to Loweâ€™s and purchased fans along with an indoor thermometer to make sure we werenâ€™t being too sensitive. We closed all curtains, put the fans directly in front of both units to circulate cool air and let them run all day while we were gone. Thermometer consistently read between 80 and 90 inside apartment. Thatâ€™s too warm for our preference.

Stairs getting to third floor were a little tricky as it is an old house, but that didnâ€™t take away from the cuteness of the apartment. There was a minor problem at check in (didnâ€™t affect our stay) but I notified Sarah and she responded and took care of it right away. Was also very communicative about a water pipe issue being fixed downstairs (due to the extreme cold of that weekend). Neither of these issues affected us very much but I appreciated her reaching out. Only one block from Forsyth park. We cooked breakfast one morning and had everything we needed. Great stay!

name: Tamara
rating_info:
Rating, 1 star
,
Â·
May 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My husband and I booked this airbnb for our first trip to Savannah (4 nights). We only stayed one night as we were very disappointed in the reality of the apartment upon arrival. While it is mentioned in the listing, I want to reitterate that this place is on the third floor and there are stairs only - no elevator. I am very surprised that this listing is for an airbnb "plus." It fell way below our standards of comfort and cleanliness. Positives first: It is decorated somewhat modern, but also cheap (everything appears to have been purchased from Ross). Second, the location is right across from the South end of Forsyth Park, but to get to the main downtown area is about a 10-15 minute walk. After one night of sitting on the incredibly uncomfortable green couch and sleeping in the noisy, hot, and light filled room, we made arrangements to move to The Perry Hotel the next day and I am so glad we did! The curtains are definitely NOT blackout, light floods into the room in the early morning hours. We arrived Memorial Day weekend, so some of the noise from fireworks and such may have been out of the host's control, but we barely slept our first night there. It was incredibly noisy all night long and we also noticed that at least two of the windows in the living room do not even lock (locks are totally broken). There was also dust and lint all over the couch and floors, hairs in the bed - just generally unclean, as well as a giant stain on the white couch in the bedroom. We were so hot all night long and the next day looked at the air conditioning unit's air filters which were completely caked with dust and overdue to be changed. I am so glad we were able to make other accomodations and enjoy the remainder of our stay. Had we had to spend all 4 nights here, it would have been a very unenjoyable experience. If you want anything resembling "modern" or "luxury", this is not the place for you.

review_text: Great location and beautiful furnishings! The dedicated parking is great, however the spaces are a bit tight, but we were still able to get a large SUV parked amongst several others! There is a fairly steep staircase upon entry so be aware if you have mobility issues. Additionally, there's another spiral staircase leading to the upper level and rooftop patio. Brandon was great and responded quickly to all questions and fixed any issues we had promptly! We will definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Savannah!!

review_text: We had the pleasure of staying at this fabulous suite for 2 nights! When we arrived the maintenance man was very helpful showing us how to get in and he even helped us carry our luggage up to the suite! Everything was just as the pictures looked! Beautiful master suite, large clean kitchen, balcony overlooking the river, and not to mention the awesome roof top patio overlooking the river with nice comfortable lounge furniture! Our beds were so comfortable and were made up with fresh white linen. This place is walking distance to almost everything which was great! If you are looking for a clean, convenient, comfortable, and beautiful place to stay, I highly recommend The Factors Penthouse! Brandon and Chase were very easy to communicate with and very responsive!

Our family of 6 absolutely loved our stay here.
- The master bedroom is stunning; the bed was comfortable and the linens were nice.
- The king bed + twin + pull out trundle was perfect for our four kids to share in the guest room.
- The whole home felt super clean and well cared for. We also loved the special treats that were waiting for us on check-in.
- Parking was super easy and the location is fantastic; one block from Forsyth. One morning I walked to The Sentiment Bean for a cup of coffee...it's just a 6 minute walk.
- Sarah was super friendly and helpful; even going so far as to meet a delivery person at the house earlier than our check-in to receive a wheelchair that we had ordered for my husband, who was on crutches. We so appreciated this above and beyond gesture.
Highly recommend!

The host is super communicative and answered any questions I had very quickly. One night the Airbnb next door was super loud until 4am. I let the owner know and she responded right away and told us if it happens again to call the cops, as they are super responsive and there is a noise ordinance. Otherwise the neighborhood is very quiet, quaint, beautiful. We had a great time and would def recommend!

review_text:
I had booked the pink house for my friends bachelorette party and was a bit disappointed with the stay. When we arrived the dog walker met us at the door and had to help us in because the lock was really hard to turn. She told us that we would have a great stay and that the 3 dogs they have are usually really quiet because we walked in and they were going a bit crazy upstairs. We all own dogs ourselves so we can handle a little barking. But unfortunately we had a few incidents where they were not home upstairs and the dogs would not stop barking and we could hear them over the tv and music. I did message Megan and she apologized and said the situation would be handled. She did have it taken care of but it was still a bit much to deal with a few times. Plus, when you walk into the main hall it does smell like wet dog. But the condo itself was fine.
As we entered the Airbnb and settled in we were super excited by the decor. It was very nicely placed and the pictures are endless! But as we went to go to bed we noticed that the bed with the lower pull out had a big yellow stain on it from someone else and all the beds had random black specs on it. All the knives in the drawer were heavily used and not cleaned either. We understand things can happen but we are disappointed that we paid so much for a weekend and a lot of small thing kept happening and we werenâ€™t even there that much. The place is beautiful but the cleaning needs to be more thorough and the dogs should be disclosed in the listing.

Nitpicks (note I rate this place a 5/5, and would return, so these are small):
1 - would like a door lock other than the smart lock, kinda like a hotel room chain lock. Itâ€™s unclear if the code changes for each guest; regardless would like something only I can unlock when there.
2 - couch faces wrong direction. Feels like a shame the 6 or so big beautiful windows with a view are behind the couch.

review_text: This was exactly what we were looking for after a week in OBX with twenty other people. It was secluded, cozy, and the view was gorgeous. Michael thought of everything from fresh eggs in the fridge to snacks for the dog (we didn't bring her but she would have felt welcomed and very happy here). Everything was immaculate and you can tell he takes pride in this property. The town of Hardeeville is small, right off I-95 and close to Savannah and HHI. There isn't a lot to do in town so you'll have to drive to just about everything. We truly enjoyed our stay. The only negative I experienced was the bed being in the loft up a ladder. There are no pictures of the ladder, just a one line caveat in the House Manual asking you to be careful, so once we got there it became clear that I wouldn't be using the loft for several personal reasons. We ended up sleeping on the pull-out couch for our stay. The pull-out is not at all comfortable, but we didn't let it ruin our stay.

Easy drive to good restaurants. We enjoyed fishing off the dock, reading on the screened-in porch, and playing in the yard with our pups. Will keep this one in mind for future quick getaways!

Perfect contactless instructions on checking in and out. Michael even provides photo instructions on using the key box.
We are both 60 and had no trouble navigating the ladder to the loft. All essentials provided- bonus points for sun screen, which we needed & forgot. Wi-Fi is excellent. GPS drops you to the door and the peace sets in.
When renting make sure to check out Michaelâ€™s local guide in the confirmation email. It was super helpful, giving lots of local tips and recommendations.
Hardeeville restaurant tip: Seafood & Soulfood. Not on Yelp or Trip Advisor but so very worth visiting. It is located on White Hardee Blvd.

Pros: Cute cabin as pictured, private/well-lit property with walk to nice river view. Cabin was cozy and equipped with necessities. Clear instructions. Allows dogs, that was nice.
Cons: Cabin had relatively pungent odor of stain or some off- gassing. No ability to open windows, no screens on any door or window. The cabin was warm, even with 2 large ceiling fans going at high speeds and a wall A/C upstairs in loft, just didnt cool the cabin. The stairs to loft were slippery, use handrail! The surrounding area was run-down and next to a graveyard. I received no response to my texts directly addressed to Michael, found that unusual, especially since a superhost. Received only the canned automated messages for reservation & check in/check out instructions. We left a day early because of smell and warm temp inside.

The dock was so perfect to relax on in the evening and the morning of our stay. The cabin was so well stocked with snacks, towels and, toiletries. I loved that he had all the switches labeled so you knew exactly where everything was and felt right at home. The shower and the changing light was so dreamy, I truly appreciated the thought put into EVERYTHING! I only wish we had stayed longer. I can imagine this is the perfect setup if you work remote and want a change of scenery. I think its important to note that there is another cabin on the property and other homes on the other end. This is not a big deal as things are very well spaced out and while we were there, we never really even ran into the other guests. Overall beautiful experience. SO glad I found this place

We loved being able to relax by the river in the mornings and head into Savannah in the afternoons for dinner and drinks. Downtown Savannah is an easy 30 minute drive from this cabin. Our dogs also loved staying here and chasing the lizards on the deck. We would book again if we were returning to Savannah!

This place and everything about our experience was incredible. Highly recommend and hope to do it again.
I was surprise visiting my mom for her 70th birthday. I live in Los Angeles and sheâ€™s in Savannah, about 30 miles from there. She brought her little dog Coco and we felt like we were on vacation in natures paradise. Beautiful dragonflies!
I wanted something special where we could relax and catch up, without noise and other people, this was perfect. Front porch rocking chairs! Great AC unit and ceiling fans. Everythingâ€™s wood and super cute. We cooked several meals in the kitchen and they have a generous set up. You can walk down to a lake with bench swings and enclosed spaces.
We drove to a local market a couple miles into town, and went to beaches and a restaurant nearby, so fun.
The hosts were always super responsive, fast, and resourceful. They were patient and kind whenever we had questions. They really wanted us to enjoy our stay and we did. I wish them great success! :)

where to begin...renovated with being sterile or cold. A great mix of old classic Savannah with new and modern amenities. Random width hardwood floors (original?), coal fireplace, large beautiful marble bathroom, all lights dimmed to set any mood, tastefully decorated (appreciated the antique hutch and armoire).
Location?? Quiet, on a square, a block from Forsyth Park and a block, block and half from other squares. 20 minute walk to the river through, guess what, more beautiful squares! Parked my vehicle and moved it once for street cleaning. My vehicle sat for 3.5 days straight and free! I believe this trip was off season but that being said it was a great value and I will definitely look to book here again when I come back to Savannah (which is regular). Beautiful unit in a fun (liver may disagree) walkable and gorgeous city. It really is just as nice if not nicer than the pictures. Great soaking tub for 2! ğŸ˜‚
A great place, enough said.

review_text: Beautiful place, would stay there again. very elegantly decorated every where you looked. Beds and pillows super comfortable (coming from someone with neck and back issues) The neighborhood is super quiet, only few steps away from John street. There's also an iconic local restaurant that we highly recommend for breakfast right across the street. Walking to Forsyth park is closer than to the River front, but if you like walking it's not that bad either. Ross is an awesome host, very quick to respond to messages. At 1st I was hesitant to stay there because it's a lower unit. With most historic/restore buildings in Savannah you'll hear a lot of noisy floors, not the case at this place. We hardly noticed any noice from the unit above us. Also, there's plenty parking spots on the streets for those that bring a car.

review_text: I can not recommend Brandon and Chaseâ€™s condo enough. If you are going to visit the lovely city of Savannah this is the place to stay. It is located right in the historic district just a block from the river. Everything is within walking distance. Brandonâ€™s communications were thorough, timely and very helpful. We enjoyed the lovely balcony off of the living room when we needed a break from sight seeing. The check in process was very easy. The parking pass provided with this rental is a big bonus! The parking garage is next door to the condo so packing/unpacking the car was easy. The condo itself is very clean, and nicely decorated. The beds and bed linens are very comfortable. We did not use the kitchen but it looked ready for cooking. We did not find the condo overly noisy as many can be in a city as it is situated away from the street. Checking out was the easiest experience I have had with an Airbnb rental. My sister and I loved our stay and I will not hesitate to book here again when I next visit this charming city. Thank you Brandon and Chase for a wonderful experience!

review_text: My husband and I have rented Airbnb's all over (Barcelona, Seville, Granada, Bermuda, Chile, Argentina, Edinburgh, Tuscany, etc.) and this was by far, the most beautiful of all the Airbnb's. It's a huge apartment/condo which is very tastefully decorated. It has everything you could need/want and right in the center of historic Savannah. It was SO nice to come home to this condo every day after being out all day. TONS of closet space; kitchen had everything you could/would need/want to cook, bake, etc. A nice touch is the JBL speaker to hook up to your phone, iPad, etc. for music. If you don't mind eating out 3 meals/day, then you do not need a car as we "walked" the City numerous times over 4 days. We did rent a car as we wanted to access to supermarkets which are not close by. We did not need any assistance from Brandon or Chase but they checked in several times to see if we needed anything. SUPER responsive. I would rent this Airbnb over and over again. It's a 5 out of 5.

Well appointed, with comfortable beds, and high end touches throughout.

Both entrances were convenient, but we preferred the â€œsideâ€ entrance closer to the park & market.
Parking was easy and was only $ 35 for 3 days at the parking garage 1 block away.

If you are sensitive to noise, I would recommend the middle bedroom instead of the bedroom on the street. The location was absolutely perfect and we enjoyed gorgeous views day and night.
This was my favorite of a dozen or more stays in Savannah and this will be our preferred place to stay for future visits.

review_text: Our stay at this AirBnB was wonderful! One of the best things about it was communication with Allan; he was quick to respond and available. He was very accommodating in letting us leave our luggage in the room while the cleaners were there, and we went to lunch and we were able to check in early. The attention to detail in the design and decor of the space was clean and impeccable; but we did notice areas that could use attention. It didn't significantly impact our stay, but it's something the host may want to address for future guests. The fireplace did not work. And, there was a large carpet stain to the entrance of the primary suite. The condo is on Bay St, convenient and yet it could be very noisy. The amenities provided were top-notch, exceeding our expectations. The kitchen was fully equipped, and the living area was cozy. In summary, our stay was positive, and we would consider returning. Our stay at this AirBnB met most expectations.
